items.title: Trump asks Australia, Albanese to join Gaza 'Board of Peace'
items.description: The US president is pushing for the board to preserve a fragile ceasefire between Hamas and Israel and progress the peace deal to the next phase.

items.title: NATO allies warn Trump of 'dangerous downward spiral' over Greenland threats
items.description: The US president says European countries will be hit with tariffs until a deal is struck that would see the Danish territory become an American possession.

items.title: Writers' Week letter shows premier backed removal of Randa Abdel-Fattah
items.description: South Australia's premier told the Adelaide Festival board it would open itself to "accusations of hypocrisy" and "legitimate public ridicule" if it did not cancel the appearance of Randa Abdel-Fattah from Writers' Week.

items.title: Boy critical after being bitten by large shark at Sydney Harbour beach
items.description: Emergency services were called to Hermitage Foreshore Walk near Shark Beach at Vaucluse about 4:20pm on Sunday afternoon following reports of a boy being bitten by a shark.

items.title: Four-year-old boy dies after car crashes into Canberra shopping centre
items.description: The accident happened at Mawson shopping centre in Canberra's south.

items.title: Williams gave fans an emotional evening in three-set loss
items.description: Undisputed great of the sport Venus Williams was welcomed back to Melbourne Park with multiple standing ovations but bowed out in the first round to Serbian Olga Danilovic.

items.title: Tourists urged to avoid WA national park amid Emergency level bushfire
items.description: Tourists are warned to avoid Fitzgerald River National Park, 500 kilometres south-east of Perth, as a bushfire burning in the park is escalated to an Emergency Warning and evacuation centres open.

items.title: Queensland stock losses to hit 100,000 as flood warnings continue
items.description: Numerous flood warnings remain active across central Queensland, with ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji still driving floodwater through major catchments, while the premier met with graziers on Sunday to discuss massive stock losses.

items.title: On the world's largest hospital ship volunteers give people a chance at a better life
items.description: On the largest civilian hospital ship in the world, Australian volunteers provide life-changing healthcare that is transforming lives.

items.title: Putin's 'worst-case scenario' could be realised in Iran regime change
items.description: Tehran is the epicentre of the nightly protests shaking Iran's regime, but the reverberations are being felt loud and clear in Moscow, too.

items.title: Body found among wreckage of plane in Indonesia
items.description: A body has been found among the wreckage of an Indonesian plane that lost contact mid-flight.

items.title: World's first legally binding treaty to protect oceans takes effect
items.description: The High Seas Treaty will govern about two-thirds of the planet's oceans including vast areas beyond any country's borders.

items.title: Liberal election autopsy delayed after Dutton suggests report defamatory
items.description: The report, co-authored by Liberal grandees Pru Goward and Nick Minchin, has now been sent to a legal team to ensure it is watertight while the party decides what step to take next.

items.title: 'It's all about fun': Cosplayers unite in celebration of geek culture
items.description: Has a surge in the popularity of hit shows like Stranger Things led to an uptick in geekiness, changing how we feel about nerd culture? The ABC attended Darwin's Geektacular event to find out.

items.title: Thousands without power amid NSW flooding, stormy weather and landslide
items.description: The State Emergency Service responds to more than 2,300 incidents and 25 flood rescues, most of which involve people driving through floodwaters.

items.title: Firefighters stop big Adelaide blaze spreading to solar batteries
items.description: About 90 firefighters have been battling a large blaze at Croydon Park that sent a large plume of smoke above the suburbs and came close to batteries for home solar systems.

items.title: Quiz: Can you conquer this week's history questions?
items.description: Trips to the moon and Mars, same-sex marriage and the first canned beer appear in this week's line-up.

items.title: Status of hate laws remains uncertain as politicians converge on Canberra
items.description: A special sitting to respond to the Bondi terror attack will begin in Canberra on Monday, but the government is no closer to landing changes to hate laws.

items.title: Dozens gather to protest fishing ban as premier defends 'tough decisions'
items.description: Dozens of disgruntled fishers have journeyed through the streets of Perth to protest against the state government's decision to ban demersal fishing, as the WA Premier Roger Cook confirmed he planned to meet with the industry.

items.title: Dog owners face prison time under proposed new 'hot car' offence in NSW
items.description: People who leave their dogs in hot cars could be sent to prison, under changes to animal welfare laws being proposed by the state government.

items.title: Great Britain edges Australia to win SailGP event in Perth
items.description: Reigning Sail Grand Prix champions Great Britain make the best possible start to season 2026, taking the win in Fremantle with a strong two-day performance culminating with victory in Sunday's final.

items.title: Australian fans pay hundreds of dollars to meet NBA icon Allen 'The Answer' Iverson
items.description: NBA great Allen Iverson left hundreds of fans star struck at a meet-and-greet event in Perth, none more so than one of the best NBL players of all time.

items.title: Wollaston produces storming finish to maintain Tour Down Under lead
items.description: Kiwi Ally Wollaston has outsprinted defending champion Noemi Ruegg to claim stage two of the Tour Down Under and keep the race lead.

items.title: US kills 'terrorist' operative linked to deadly IS ambush of three Americans in Syria
items.description: CENTCOM says it conducted a strike in north-west Syria that resulted in the death of an Al Qaeda operative linked to the ISIS gunman responsible for killing two US soldiers and a US civilian in Syria on December 13.

items.title: Bushfires' devastating toll on animal life beginning to emerge
items.description: From animal shelters to "entire generations" of bat colonies, heartbreaking stories of the significant loss of animal life are beginning to emerge in the wake of Victoria's disastrous bushfires and severe heat.
